attributes.action: "Life" for acid attacks to become the standard sentencing guide in all cases
attributes.additional_details:
At present courts are encouraged to consider age, maturity and circumstances of offenders when sentencing & generally, adults convicted of carrying acid in public for a 2nd time will be imprisoned for 6 months. 

Clearly, current sentencing guidelines are ineffective in deterring acid attacks as they continue to rise within the UK.

A standard life sentence of min 25-30 yrs for ALL adult offenders committing these horrific crimes should act as a more effective deterrent.
attributes.background: Victims of acid attacks are faced with the prospect of life long disfigurement, blindness and mental health issues such as: anxiety & depression. It should become the standard for those who plan & commit these crimes to face life imprisonment with the min. of 25- 30 years in every case.
